meanings.definition: To hire or engage (someone) for work again.
meanings.sent1: After being laid off, the company decided to reemploy me.
meanings.sent2: The company will reemploy the experienced workers for the new project.
meanings.sent3: I never thought they would reemploy me after I accidentally spilled coffee on the boss.
meanings.sent4: The old factory reemployed the retired workers to help with the holiday rush.
meanings.sent5: She was reemployed by the same company she had worked for years ago.

meanings.definition: To find work for (someone) after a period of unemployment.
meanings.sent1: The job center helped reemploy many individuals who had been out of work for months.
meanings.sent2: It can be challenging to reemploy individuals who have been unemployed for a long time.
meanings.sent3: The career fair aimed to reemploy as many people as possible in the struggling economy.
meanings.sent4: She felt relieved when the company decided to reemploy her after a long job search.
meanings.sent5: The government program successfully reemployed many citizens who were struggling to find work.
